intro.title: About the Service
intro.text: This digital and interactive service presents spatial data and illustrates green transition indicators in the South Savo region, Finland. The service visualises activities associated with green transition such as sustainable mobility, energy efficiency and greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions. An AI-based analysis and strategy-recommendation tool is also available for the most open-minded.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.text: The digital service allows easy comparisons between green transition indicators based on the local and regional spatial data. The visual presentation of these indicators improves understanding the current situation in sustainability transition, allows more accurate monitoring and show potential development targets for the municipalities in their journey towards the more sustainable future.

about.title: Development
about.text: The service fosters regional cooperation and advances green transition activities in the region of South Savo. The green transition in South Savo service is developed in <innocapLink>{{innocapText}}</innocapLink> funded by the European Union's Northern Periphery and Arctic programme. The service is designed and maintained by the <hidseLink>{{hidse}}</hidseLink> at the <ruraliaLink>{{ruralia}}</ruraliaLink>, the University of Helsinki in collaboration with <mindhiveLink>{{mindhive}}</mindhiveLink> company.

information.title: Site Information
information.description: Here is basic information about how to use the "Green transition in South Savo" service and understand the basics of the shown green transition indicators. The dashboard provides an interactive way to explore and compare different green transition indicators across municipalities in the South Savo region, Finland.

navigation.title: Basic Navigation
items: Click on municipalities to see detailed information
Use the side navigation to switch between different indicator categories
Explore the map to understand regional patterns

indicators.title: Working with Indicators
items: Note: The municipalities of Pertunmaa and Mäntyharju merged into the Municipality of Mäntyharju as of January 1, 2025. The data from open sources in the map service covers the period before the municipal merger, up until the year 2024.
Select an indicator to view it on the map
Pin an indicator to compare it with another indicator, open additional information associated with an indicator by clicking the icon on a map
The indicators are grouped in major green transition classes: protected areas, sustainable mobility, energy efficiency, sustainable investments, recycling and greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions

ai.title: AI Assistant
items: The AI Assistant responds to text-based questions (icon in the bottom right corner)
The AI Assistant is in development phase and its functionality is limited

The AI Assistant utilizes information about municipalities in South Savo (municipal strategies and climate programs), openly available research articles on green and digital transition, as well as European Union policy documents
Users can provide positive or negative feedback on the AI Assistant's responses (through "thumbs up/down" rating). Additionally, feedback can be provided in writing
